meanings.definition: A type of soil rich in humus and typically found in grasslands.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted his crops in rendzinas to ensure they would grow well.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the rendzinas in the grasslands to understand their composition.
meanings.sent3: The worms in the rendzinas had a party, celebrating the fertile soil.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the plants embraced the rendzinas like a warm hug, drawing nutrients from it.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the rendzinas was so earthy and inviting, like a cozy blanket for the plants.

meanings.definition: The plural form of rendzina, referring to multiple instances of this type of soil.
meanings.sent1: The farmers harvested various rendzinas from different parts of the grasslands.
meanings.sent2: The researchers compared the rendzinas they collected to analyze any differences.
meanings.sent3: The rendzinas gathered for a conference, discussing their fertility and richness.
